name: Sticky floors, Glass ceilings and Leaky pipelines: Understanding Trends in Women's Employment in India
description:
Why are so few of India’s women employed? What does it mean to be counted as employed? What kinds of employment do women predominantly engage in, particularly in our cities? Come join Rosa Abraham as she explores how labour force surveys measure employment and discuss the implications for the measurement of women’s work.

Until recently, the proportion of employed women has steadily declined in rural areas and stagnated in urban areas. There have been several explanations for the low and declining rates of participation of women in the workforce. One perspective argues that women's domestic work, care burden and gender-based norms keep women out of the paid workforce. A more recent argument points towards the lack of job creation as a fundamental reason for fewer women in the workforce. Drawing on primary surveys and official secondary data, Rosa will examine each of these explanations to better understand the reasons behind the persistently low and falling rates of women’s employment in India.

name: Building the City: Managing Mobile Labour in Bengaluru's Construction Industry
description:
How have policies and practices concerning migrant workers in India evolved since the Covid-19 migrant labour crisis, and what does this tell us about the continuing reliance of the organised construction industry on informal labour contracting?

Over the last several decades, Bengaluru’s urban environment has been dramatically altered by high-rise apartment complexes, glitzy business parks, and new infrastructure such as the metro-rail line. This construction boom has relied on the supply of thousands of workers sourced from distant states such as Bihar and Jharkhand. The precarious working conditions of migrant workers in Indian cities became starkly evident during the Covid-19 lockdown of 2020, spurring the central and state governments to initiate or enforce policies and welfare schemes for the protection of migrant workers. Join Carol Upadhya as she explores the contracting system of labour supply and management in the construction industry and the responsibilities of employers and the state for ensuring the implementation of laws and policies for migrant workers. The discussion will also highlight the new and evolving ways in which ‘informal’ and 'formal' modes of organizational control are tightly entangled in this sector and its implications for workers' rights and security.

name: Studio Visit to Pagal Canvas
description: Science Gallery Bengaluru is taking you on a visit to Pagal Canvas Studio to give you an exclusive glimpse into their creative process, from showcasing their publications to demonstrating diverse printing techniques. Come join us and immerse yourself in a hands-on Mono-printing workshop using unique botanical prints inspired by nature, experimenting with textures and patterns to craft a one-of-a-kind masterpiece. Explore the vibrant world of printmaking at Pagal Canvas Studio!

name: Science and Society: A Sci560 Exhibition Walkthrough
description: What role does society play in shaping groundbreaking scientific discoveries and innovations? How have dominant societal beliefs, when challenged by science or those pursuing it, influenced the course of history? Throughout time, the tension between established societal norms and the ideas of science has sparked some of the most transformative moments in human history.  Join our mediator, Akshad, as he walks you through Sci560, our latest exhibition, and uncovers the fascinating interplay between science and society.
